intro: Cheiridopsis eburnea, commonly known as the silver leaf ice plant, is a succulent belonging to the Aizoaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, silver-gray leaves that store water. Its small, daisy-like flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Cheiridopsis eburnea is well adapted to hot, dry climates and requires minimal water once established.
